Topic.Title: The Hollowing Out of Government

Message.Msg: In 2011 OSHA was funded $573,096,000, Funding for 2013 is $565,468,000 or about a 1.3% reduction. Now you and some stupid reporter want to call a 1.3% reduction hollowing out...oh the humanity, You may also want to factor in businesses going out of business due to obamas anti business policies, there is less for OSHA to police. If the plant blew due to some safety violation by the business it is also due to the ineptitude of government not a whooping 1.3% reduction in budget. And another news flash - Since 2006 the libs have been driving the boat, so if OSHA is suffering with only 1/2 a billion & change dollars you might want to talk to Nancy, Harry and the pimp in the WH.

Topic.Title: The Cancer of Unregulated Capitalism

Message.Msg: Hooz, The violin concerto that you are playing is breath taking. On your first point ("Attacking the Hungry"): "The uncontrolled growth of investment wealth is diverting resources away from vital programs, effectively smothering them." (totally speculative assumption) "The average Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) recipient received about $1,500 for food for the entire year." (and they should be very, extremely thankful. Are they?) "At least ten Americans each made that much in under ten seconds from their investment gains in 2012, about the time it took each one to fluff his pillow and roll over in bed." (while the vast majority of SNAP recipients likely fail to get out of bed until lunch time, but that is my own speculative assumption) "Under capitalism, fortunes accrue to a few while 47 million Americans, or one out of seven, need foodassistance. Almost half of the hungry are children. For every food bank we had in 1980, we now have 200." (get a job, pay your own way, provide for the children that you decided to have; as you can imagine I am straining to not cite a Bible verse, but for Genna's sake I hold back ...) "Yet just 20 people made more from their investment income in one year than the entire 2011 food assistance budget. That's $73 billion, taxed at the capital gains rate. Meanwhile, President Obama couldn't get the $1 billion per year he needed to improve childhood nutrition in schools." (OK, I get the distortion issue, but it really did not occur until we moved manufacturing jobs overseas. Fix that first. Let me make this clear: industry and business, with the right incentives, should fix that, not the government.) "Most recently, the House proposed a farm bill that would cut another $2 billion a year from the food stamps account." (get a job and feed yourself, once again ....) BB

Message.Msg: Censored. I am sure that this is not lost on you or anybody. We are in a quagmire with Islamic extremism. If we consider WW2, it was a war in which we utterly decimated the enemy, beating the armies and the peoples into subjection. Once they were truly defeated, we were able to remold them into great nations and great allies. This so-called "precision" method of drone warring is not winning anything, but instead is creating seething hatred for the United States - across the world. We had the high road when we first invaded Afghanistan, then we "lost our way" starting in Iraq. The first war with Iraq in 1991 was also the high road, taking the folks and leadership of Iraq to a position of subjection. However, these "surgical" wars are simply not working because they are not the "high road" and do not utterly destroy the leaders and people that are causing the problems. We are not creating the object lessons through drones that are necessary to get the results that we want - long lasting good behavior. Instead of trying to police the world, we should simply let people do to themselves and others what they desire - however the blackness in their hearts lead them. Now, should they cross over into our territory or those of our allies, then pounce on them without mercy. That results in a long lasting object lesson that is not lost on anyone.

Message.Title: Right Wing Terrorist Arrested in Minneapolis !
Message.Msg: FBI officials said Monday they foiled a terrorist attack being planned in a small western Minnesota town, but they offered no details about the exact targets of the attack – or the motive of the man accused of having a cache of explosives and weapons in a mobile home. The FBI said "the lives of several local residents were potentially saved" with the arrest of Buford Rogers, 24, who made his first appearance Monday in U.S. District Court in St. Paul on one count of being a felon in possession of a firearm. Rogers, of Montevideo, was arrested Friday after authorities searched a mobile home he's associated with and found Molotov cocktails, suspected pipe bombs and firearms, according to a court affidavit. "The FBI believed there was a terror attack in its planning stages, and we believe there would have been a localized terror attack, and that's why law enforcement moved quickly to execute the search warrant on Friday to arrest Mr. Rogers," FBI spokesman Kyle Loven said Monday. He said the investigation is ongoing, and agents are looking at the case as one of domestic terrorism.

Message.Title: even liberal nbc now mentions benghazi
Message.Msg: ...Gregory Hicks, then deputy chief of the U.S. diplomatic mission in Libya, told investigators for the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee that U.S. officials had persuaded the Libyan government to allow the Special Forces operatives to board the rescue flight from Tripoli to Benghazi. But an officer received a phone call telling them to stand down before they left for the airport, according to excerpts of his account made available to NBC News on Monday. That conversation occurred after the U.S. ambassador to Libya and another American had been killed in the initial attack, but hours before a second attack that killed two other Americans. Advertise | AdChoices Hicks quoted a Special Forces commander as telling him, "I have never been so embarrassed in my life, that a State Department officer has bigger balls than somebody in the military," referring to his willingness to authorize the mission. U.S. military officials confirmed Hicks' account late Monday, but said the team was reviewing security measures at the Embassy and was not equipped for combat.... +++ riight - no doubt the libya military refused to loan or give the U.S troops an ak 47 or any other lethal weapon without a full background check and gun permit and approval from some other bcrats.. After all they are trying to learn the American way !

Message.Title: yes Obama gave 1%...cheapskate expects others to pay his way
Message.Msg: WHO'S GREEDY? Obama Gave 1% to Charity, Romney Gave 15% Fire it up 1 Share AP File Democratic presidential candidate Barack Obama and his wife Michelle gave $10,772 of the $1.2 million they earned from 2000 through 2004 to charities, or less than 1 percent, according to tax returns for those years released today by his campaign. The Obamas increased the amount they gave to charity when their income rose in 2005 and 2006 after the Illinois senator published a bestselling book. The $137,622 they gave over those two years amounted to more than 5 percent of their $2.6 million income.
